com.mapcode

Class MapcodeCodec

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapcode.MapcodeCodec

  • public final class MapcodeCodec
extends Object
    This class is the external Java interface for encoding and decoding mapcodes.

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        @Nonnull
public static List<Mapcode> encode(double latDeg,
                                            double lonDeg)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Encode a lat/lon pair to a mapcode with territory information. This produces a non-empty list of mapcode, with at the very least 1 mapcodes for the lat/lon, which is the "International" mapcode. The returned result list will always contain at least 1 mapcode, because every lat/lon pair can be encoded. The list is ordered in such a way that the last result is the international code. However, you cannot assume that the first result is the shortest mapcode. If you want to use the shortest mapcode, use encodeToShortest(double, double, Territory). The international code can be obtained from the list by using: "results.get(results.size() - 1)", or you can use encodeToInternational(double, double), which is faster.
        Parameters:
        latDeg - Latitude, accepted range: -90..90.
        lonDeg - Longitude, accepted range: -180..180.
        Returns:
        Non-empty, ordered list of mapcode information records, see Mapcode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if latitude or longitude are out of range.

      • encode

        @Nonnull
public static List<Mapcode> encode(@Nonnull
                                            Point point)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • encode

        @Nonnull
public static List<Mapcode> encode(double latDeg,
                                            double lonDeg,
                                            @Nullable
                                            Territory restrictToTerritory)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Encode a lat/lon pair to a mapcode with territory information, for a specific territory. This produces a potentially empty list of mapcodes (empty if the lat/lon does not fall within the territory for mapcodes). The returned result list will always contain at least 1 mapcode, because every lat/lon pair can be encoded. The list is ordered in such a way that the last result is the international code. However, you cannot assume that the first result is the shortest mapcode. If you want to use the shortest mapcode, use encodeToShortest(double, double, Territory).
        Parameters:
        latDeg - Latitude, accepted range: -90..90 (limited to this range if outside).
        lonDeg - Longitude, accepted range: -180..180 (wrapped to this range if outside).
        restrictToTerritory - Try to encode only within this territory, see Territory. May be null.
        Returns:
        List of mapcode information records, see Mapcode. This list is empty if no Mapcode can be generated for this territory matching the lat/lon.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if latitude or longitude are out of range.

      • encode

        @Nonnull
public static List<Mapcode> encode(@Nonnull
                                            Point point,
                                            @Nullable
                                            Territory restrictToTerritory)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • encodeRestrictToCountryISO2

        @Nonnull
public static List<Mapcode> encodeRestrictToCountryISO2(double latDeg,
                                                                 double lonDeg,
                                                                 @Nonnull
                                                                 String countryISO2)
                                                          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Encode a lat/lon pair to a list of mapcodes, like encode(double, double). The result list is limited to those mapcodes that belong to the provided ISO 3166 country code, 2 characters. For example, if you wish to restrict the list to Mexican mapcodes, use "MX". This would produce a result list of mapcodes with territories that start with "MX-" (note that a mapcode that starts with "MEX" is not returned in that case.)
        Parameters:
        latDeg - Latitude, accepted range: -90..90.
        lonDeg - Longitude, accepted range: -180..180.
        countryISO2 - ISO 3166 country code, 2 characters.
        Returns:
        Possibly empty, ordered list of mapcode information records, see Mapcode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if latitude or longitude are out of range, or if the ISO code is invalid.

      • encodeRestrictToCountryISO2

        @Nonnull
public static List<Mapcode> encodeRestrictToCountryISO2(@Nonnull
                                                                 Point point,
                                                                 @Nonnull
                                                                 String countryISO2)
                                                          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • encodeRestrictToCountryISO3

        @Nonnull
public static List<Mapcode> encodeRestrictToCountryISO3(double latDeg,
                                                                 double lonDeg,
                                                                 @Nonnull
                                                                 String countryISO3)
                                                          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Encode a lat/lon pair to a list of mapcodes, like encode(double, double). The result list is limited to those mapcodes that belong to the provided ISO 3166 country code, 3 characters. For example, if you wish to restrict the list to Mexican mapcodes, use "MEX". This would produce a result list of mapcodes with territories that start with "MEX" (note that mapcode that starts with "MX-" are not returned in that case.)
        Parameters:
        latDeg - Latitude, accepted range: -90..90.
        lonDeg - Longitude, accepted range: -180..180.
        countryISO3 - ISO 3166 country code, 3 characters.
        Returns:
        Possibly empty, ordered list of mapcode information records, see Mapcode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if latitude or longitude are out of range, or if the ISO code is invalid.

                                                                 String countryISO3)

      • encodeToShortest

        @Nonnull
public static Mapcode encodeToShortest(double latDeg,
                                                double lonDeg,
                                                @Nonnull
                                                Territory restrictToTerritory)
                                         throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                UnknownMapcodeException
        Encode a lat/lon pair to its shortest mapcode with territory information.
        Parameters:
        latDeg - Latitude, accepted range: -90..90.
        lonDeg - Longitude, accepted range: -180..180.
        restrictToTerritory - Try to encode only within this territory, see Territory. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Shortest mapcode, see Mapcode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if latitude or longitude are out of range.
        UnknownMapcodeException - Thrown if no mapcode was found for the lat/lon matching the territory.

        @Nonnull
public static Mapcode encodeToShortest(@Nonnull
                                                Point point,
                                                @Nonnull
                                                Territory restrictToTerritory)
                                         throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                UnknownMapcodeException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        UnknownMapcodeException

      • encodeToInternational

        @Nonnull
public static Mapcode encodeToInternational(double latDeg,
                                                     double lonDeg)
                                              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Encode a lat/lon pair to its unambiguous, international mapcode.
        Parameters:
        latDeg - Latitude, accepted range: -90..90.
        lonDeg - Longitude, accepted range: -180..180.
        Returns:
        International unambiguous mapcode (always exists), see Mapcode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if latitude or longitude are out of range.

      • decode

        @Nonnull
public static Point decode(@Nonnull
                                    String mapcode)
                             throws UnknownMapcodeException,
                                    IllegalArgumentException,
                                    UnknownPrecisionFormatException
        Decode a mapcode to a Point. The decoding process may fail for local mapcodes, because no territory context is supplied (world-wide). The accepted format is: {mapcode} {territory-code} {mapcode}
        Parameters:
        mapcode - Mapcode.
        Returns:
        Point corresponding to mapcode.
        Throws:
        UnknownMapcodeException - Thrown if the mapcode has the correct syntax, but cannot be decoded into a point.
        UnknownPrecisionFormatException - Thrown if the precision format is incorrect.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if arguments are null, or if the syntax of the mapcode is incorrect.

      • decode

        @Nonnull
public static Point decode(@Nonnull
                                    String mapcode,
                                    @Nullable
                                    Territory defaultTerritoryContext)
                             throws UnknownMapcodeException,
                                    IllegalArgumentException,
                                    UnknownPrecisionFormatException
        Decode a mapcode to a Point. A reference territory is supplied for disambiguation (only used if applicable). The accepted format is: {mapcode} {territory-code} {mapcode} Note that if a territory-code is supplied in the string, it takes preferences over the parameter.
        Parameters:
        mapcode - Mapcode.
        defaultTerritoryContext - Default territory context for disambiguation purposes. May be null.
        Returns:
        Point corresponding to mapcode. Latitude range: -90..90, longitude range: -180..180.
        Throws:
        UnknownMapcodeException - Thrown if the mapcode has the right syntax, but cannot be decoded into a point.
        UnknownPrecisionFormatException - Thrown if the precision format is incorrect.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if arguments are null, or if the syntax of the mapcode is incorrect.

      • decodeToRectangle

        @Nonnull
public static Rectangle decodeToRectangle(@Nonnull
                                                   String mapcode)
                                            throws UnknownMapcodeException,
                                                   IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   UnknownPrecisionFormatException
        Decode a mapcode to a Rectangle, which defines the valid zone for a mapcode. The boundaries of the mapcode zone are inclusive for the South and West borders and exclusive for the North and East borders. This is essentially the same call as a 'decode', except it returns a rectangle, rather than its center point.
        Parameters:
        mapcode - Mapcode.
        Returns:
        Rectangle Mapcode zone. South/West borders are inclusive, North/East borders exclusive.
        Throws:
        UnknownMapcodeException - Thrown if the mapcode has the correct syntax, but cannot be decoded into a point.
        UnknownPrecisionFormatException - Thrown if the precision format is incorrect.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if arguments are null, or if the syntax of the mapcode is incorrect.

      • decodeToRectangle

        @Nonnull
public static Rectangle decodeToRectangle(@Nonnull
                                                   String mapcode,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Territory defaultTerritoryContext)
                                            throws UnknownMapcodeException,
                                                   IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   UnknownPrecisionFormatException
        Decode a mapcode to a Rectangle, which defines the valid zone for a mapcode. The boundaries of the mapcode zone are inclusive for the South and West borders and exclusive for the North and East borders. This is essentially the same call as a 'decode', except it returns a rectangle, rather than its center point.
        Parameters:
        mapcode - Mapcode.
        defaultTerritoryContext - Default territory context for disambiguation purposes. May be null.
        Returns:
        Rectangle Mapcode zone. South/West borders are inclusive, North/East borders exclusive.
        Throws:
        UnknownMapcodeException - Thrown if the mapcode has the correct syntax, but cannot be decoded into a point.
        UnknownPrecisionFormatException - Thrown if the precision format is incorrect.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if arguments are null, or if the syntax of the mapcode is incorrect.

      • isNearMultipleBorders

        public static boolean isNearMultipleBorders(@Nonnull
                                            Point point,
                                            @Nonnull
                                            Territory territory)
        Is coordinate near multiple territory borders?
        Parameters:
        point - Latitude/Longitude in degrees.
        territory - Territory.
        Returns:
        true Iff the coordinate is near more than one territory border (and thus encode(decode(M)) may not produce M).
